week1_questions.question: What does Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) encompass, and why is it considered multidisciplinary?
options: It only involves computer programming and interface design
HCI merges principles from psychology, computer science, and cognitive science to design interactive systems that cater to human needs
HCI focuses solely on improving the hardware performance of systems
It is limited to understanding how computers process data

week1_questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically associated with the study of HCI?
options: Social and cultural factors influencing how people use technology
User interface design and evaluation
Understanding how computers communicate over a network
Psychological aspects that impact user interaction with systems

week1_questions.question: When did HCI emerge as a distinct academic and research field, and what prompted its formalization?
options: 1950s, due to the development of early mainframe systems
1980s, following the rise of personal computing and the need for user-friendly interfaces
1990s, with the advent of the Internet and online interactions
2000s, as mobile devices became widely adopted

week1_questions.question: Which of the following best explains the core focus of HCI in modern system design?
options: Hardware development
Usability and creating systems that are intuitive and accessible for all users
Designing better networking protocols
Operating system efficiency

week1_questions.question: What is User-Centered Design (UCD) and why is it integral to HCI?
options: A process used for hardware design
An iterative process that puts the needs of users at the forefront of design, continuously incorporating user feedback
A one-time process focused on system performance
A design methodology that only considers technical capabilities

week1_questions.question: In the context of UCD, what is the importance of understanding the 'context of use'?
options: It helps detect flaws in system hardware
It provides crucial insights into the environment, tasks, and user characteristics that the system must support
It focuses on creating static requirements
It ensures the system is compatible with all hardware configurations

week1_questions.question: True or False: User-Centered Design (UCD) is a one-time process that concludes once the system is deployed.
options: True
False

week1_questions.question: What is the primary focus of UCD, and how does it affect system success?
options: Ensuring high system performance across all devices
Designing for usability to ensure the system meets the needs and capabilities of a diverse user base
Minimizing development costs
Focusing on hardware compatibility to maximize system efficiency

week1_questions.question: Which of the following represents a missing phase in User-Centered Design (UCD)?
options: Identifying user requirements
Developing technical solutions
Deploying the system without feedback
Evaluating the solution’s usability based on user feedback

week1_questions.question: What is the ultimate goal of User Interface (UI) design in HCI?
options: To make the interface complex and feature-rich
To create an interface that is invisible to users and free of frustration, allowing them to achieve tasks effortlessly
To optimize system performance above all else
To make hardware as accessible as possible

week1_questions.question: Which of the following types of interfaces does UI design address in HCI?
options: Graphical User Interfaces (GUIs)
Command-line interfaces
Voice-controlled interfaces (VUIs)
All of the above, as UI design spans across multiple interaction paradigms

week1_questions.question: Which of Norman’s principles is most closely aligned with providing clear and immediate feedback for user actions?
options: Visibility
Feedback
Consistency
Affordance

week1_questions.question: True or False: The aesthetics of a UI are always more important to users than its usability.
options: True
False

week1_questions.question: Which of Norman’s principles aims to limit user errors by constraining possible actions within the system?
options: Visibility
Feedback
Constraints
Mapping
